Dutch[edit]

Dutch Wikipedia has an article on:
Westerse wereld
Wikipedia nl

Etymology[edit]

From west

Pronunciation[edit]

  • Audio
    		(file)
  • Hyphenation: Wes‧ten

Noun[edit]

Westen n (uncountable)

  1. The West
    De zon gaat onder in het Westen.
    The sun sets in the west.

Antonyms[edit]

  • Oosten

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From West.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈvɛstən/
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

German Wikipedia has an article on:
Westen
Wikipedia de

Westen m (genitive Westens, no plural)

  1. west
  2. (only with definite article) The area of Western Germany, i.e. those territories which were never part of the GDR.

Declension[edit]

Declension of Westen (uncountable)
singular
indef.def.noun
nominativeeinderWesten
genitiveeinesdesWestens
dativeeinemdemWesten
accusativeeinendenWesten

Antonyms[edit]

  • Osten
